newsitem.title: EGYPT: Bank of Alexandria's year-end profit rises.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Alexandria's year-end profit rises.

text.p: Egypt's Bank of Alexandria, one of the four big state-owned retail banks, said on Saturday it increased its distributable profits in the financial year 1995/96 to 49.5 million pounds ($14.6 million) from 42 million in the previous year. The financial year ends on June 30.
Customers' deposits rose to 14,068 million from 13,876 million in 94/95.
The bank's total assets on June 30, 1996, also rose to 19,489 million from 18,986 million one year earlier.
Shareholders' funds went up slightly to 895.7 million pounds at the end of 1995/96 from 858.2 million at the end of 1994/5.
